title: Has started eating up more battery
comment: Shows keep awake for almost 11 hours. This didn't used to be a problem. Hope it is only temporary.

Are you logged into reddit?
If so you can reduce the new message check frequency via the settings.

title: Fixed it
comment: Thank you for the timely update

Please clear application data. & try reinstalling. 
Also is would be helpful if you actually describe the issue!!
Thanks
Edit: thanks for the feedback.

title: Best reddit widget
comment: This app has the best home screen widget of all the reddit apps,  which is how I use the app exclusively.   - - - -     After update today,  cannot change theme.  Creating one and applying does nothing.  Have cleared app data several times.  Tried restarting... No luck.  Please fix to get my 5 stars.  Nexus 7. Android 5.1 - - - - edit: resolved following suggestion.

Hey Will you might have a similar issue as Asylus above,
Go to the subreddit selection activity and change the widget theme to "Use app theme".
Let me know if it helps.

title: Last update ruined app
comment: Don't try to fix something that isn't broke. After update, Feature themes don't work and when I try to customize a theme to get the one I want, the app crashes. Listen to these comments please.

We're looking into it!
Edit: Last update should have fixed your issue, please keep us updated.
Great app. No special permissions or anything!

title: Great app for reddit. Just some minor tweaks needed
comment: Love the app, great for getting quick updates on world news, or seeing some cool, user submitted creations... There were some issues when I first got the app, I wasn't able to log in, but you have since fixed that, which is awesome. This app is great, I highly recommend it to both reddit users, & anyone that wants to keep up with world news, tech news, etc.

title: No special permissions!
comment: Thank you

title: Still the best.
comment: After latest update some of the rough edges were smoothed out. Best widget/app for reddit hands down.

title: Could be improved
comment: It's fine enough, but there are glitches and bugs that can get really annoying.
If you can be more specific, we can work towards fixing those bugs in the next release.

title: Moto X
comment: Love this reddit widget, but Is there a way to see all your subreddits at once without having to click each one individually? Hope I'm not just missing something obvious. thank you

Hey Peter,

If you sign in with your account check the "remember" checkbox, the "Front" subreddit will always contain posts from your subscribed subs.

title: 5 stars all the way
comment: Awesome and easy to use always reliable . . Great application

title: My favorite reddit widget
comment: Very nice widget, just need glass transparent theme 😊

title: Unable to comment?
comment: Whenever I view a post, I am unable to type a comment. Not sure if its a problem on my side, but would rate higher if I could.
Interested to know if the knew comments view has fixed this issue?

title: Best reddit widget out there
comment: I use a lot of widgets and of all the widgets out there this is the best. I just wish they had more customized settings I would gladly pay for a pro version.

Thanks for your feedback,

Please let me know what other customizations you would like to see in the next version.
Reddinator will always be free but I may include a donation version so you can buy me a beer :-D

title: Best reddit widget so far
comment: No other good alternative available. This one is the best right now.

title: Needs
comment: Card view would be nice but for sure needs a way to save images, gifs to device SD card, also a better way of viewing videos like opening in our own media player and with the widget it will not stay on my front page it keeps going back to its own default front page needs fixed to stay on my frontpage when all above is added and available this app will be closer to excellent.
Thanks for the feedback, can you confirm that you are ticking the "remember" checkbox when logging in?

title: Awesome
comment: Great app. Keeps me up to date with everything. Never had any problems

title: My favouite reddit app
comment: This app fully embraces how I like to browse reddit; quickly and conveniently.     Only thing I would like added is a kitkat theme that looks like holo but has a more clear/glass like look that kitkat has.  Also if it's possible make it zoom out images with high resolutions automatically.  It's annoying zooming out to actually see most images.

title: Great widget but needs updated
comment: I've noticed some minor bugs here and there lately with this widget that are becoming more frustrating and unfortunately prevalent. The first and most annoying being the issue with viewing images. For whatever reason, posts that link to a photo on nearly any outside website are unviewable. The screen goes blank and white. One of the best things about reddit is the pictures! So if an update could be made to address this problem, we'd all be happy campers! It was a small issue but has grown to frequently.

title: Looks good so far
comment: So this is an initial impression. I really like a lot of the design choices, keep up the good work. The one lingering issue I have right now is the settings seem to only allow the widget to update, at most, every hour. With a fast as some subs move this just isn't good enough, is like to see it go as low as one minute.

Hey Nathan, thanks for the feedback! 
Of course you can update your feeds on demand by clicking the refresh button on each widget and in the App feed.
If you'd like I can add in a 30minutes item in the "auto update" feature for the next update

title: Love it!
comment: A great replacement for baconreader's scrolling widget if you are moving to another client.

Front page is there, you just need to add it to your subreddits.
I'll probably make feeds like front page and all show up there by default in the next version, it is indeed a bit misleading.

title: Issue
comment: Keeps changing back to the default front page.  *edit even with update, issue persists. It was even harder to log in and sync my subs.
We have recently changed the way the app interacts with reddit. This issue should be sorted.
Good looking widget

Have you tried clearing the application data or reinstalling?
I'll need you to give exact details of what's happening, so I can recreate the problem.

UPDATE: New version out, give it another go :-D

title: Last update has adware
comment: Was updating this app and was told by AVG it is now malicious with adware so uninstalled.  Don't know what they have done to it but it was good.

There is no malicious code in the application I assure you. 
It's open source and anyone can see the code at: https://github.com/micwallace/reddinator
It's ad free and will be for life.

title: Well done
comment: A decent Reddit widget
Nice

title: I love it
comment: Most feature rich reddit widget with Reddinator view that gives you both content and comments tab. You can also set to open posts with your favourite browser if you wish. It also looks beautiful with dark skin and it has the load more button at the end of scroll.

title: Best reddit widget
comment: Able to use a lot of options and bring in your accounts own subreddit subscription.

title: Easily the best reddit app around!
comment: Extremely pleasent and easy to use. The widget size is customizible, and it looks extremely good. Awesome job guys.

title: Best reddit app
comment: Never crashes, easy to use, and a good amount of customization available.

title: Nice
comment: This is great. Only suggestion is a dark theme or transparency.
Easy to use looks good on my S3.

title: Great widget
comment: Awesome app much better then others I use

title: Nice
comment: Very nice looking and easy to use. Looking  forward to seeing it grow.

title: Honeycomb and above only
comment: Turns out I cant run the app with my version of android :-(   Which is a real shame because the app looks really good.

title: Cool app
comment: Using this on my home page :)

title: Great Start
comment: This widget is great. I love how official looking it is and that it works with my existing reddit apps.Keep up the good work, looking forward to more updates, thumbnails would be awesome.
